title: 18k-Mile 2005 Ferrari 360 Spider 6-Speed at No Reserve
description: This 2005 Ferrari 360 Spider has 18k miles, and it was specified in Rosso Corsa over beige leather. It is powered by a 3.6-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18" two-piece BBS alloy wheels, a black convertible soft top, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, a Challenge-style rear grille, power-adjustable Daytona-style seats, a gated shifter, a CD stereo, a wind deflector, and automatic climate control. This 360 Spider is now offered in California by the selling dealer at no reserve with a car cover, tools, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 18k-Mile 2005 Ferrari 360 Spider 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #201,586.
text: This 2005 Ferrari 360 Spider has 18k miles, and it was specified in Rosso Corsa over beige leather. It is powered by a 3.6-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18″ two-piece BBS alloy wheels, a black convertible soft top, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, a Challenge-style rear grille, power-adjustable Daytona-style seats, a gated shifter, a CD stereo, a wind deflector, and automatic climate control. This 360 Spider is now offered in California by the selling dealer at no reserve with a car cover, tools, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title. The Pininfarina-designed aluminum body is finished in Rosso Corsa and features xenon headlights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, a power-retractable black convertible soft top, a Challenge-style rear grille, and quad exhaust outlets exiting through the rear fascia. The 18″ two-piece BBS alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Stopping power is from red-finished Ferrari-branded calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors at each corner. The cockpit features power-adjustable Daytona-style seats upholstered in beige leather with black accents. Amenities include a gated shifter, a CD stereo, aluminum pedals, a wind deflector, and automatic climate control. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 220-mph speedometer and a tachometer with an 8,500-rpm redline as well as a digital fuel level readout and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 18k miles. The mid-mounted 3.6-liter Tipo F131 V8 features a flat-plane crankshaft, dry-sump lubrication, dual overhead camshafts, and five valves per cylinder. Factory-rated output was 395 horsepower and 275 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. html:
This 2005 Ferrari 360 Spider has 18k miles, and it was specified in Rosso Corsa over beige leather. It is powered by a 3.6-liter V8 paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18″ two-piece BBS alloy wheels, a black convertible soft top, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, a Challenge-style rear grille, power-adjustable Daytona-style seats, a gated shifter, a CD stereo, a wind deflector, and automatic climate control. This 360 Spider is now offered in California by the selling dealer at no reserve with a car cover, tools, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title.

The Pininfarina-designed aluminum body is finished in Rosso Corsa and features xenon headlights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, a power-retractable black convertible soft top, a Challenge-style rear grille, and quad exhaust outlets exiting through the rear fascia.

The 18″ two-piece BBS alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Stopping power is from red-finished Ferrari-branded calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors at each corner.

The cockpit features power-adjustable Daytona-style seats upholstered in beige leather with black accents. Amenities include a gated shifter, a CD stereo, aluminum pedals, a wind deflector, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 220-mph speedometer and a tachometer with an 8,500-rpm redline as well as a digital fuel level readout and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 18k miles.

The mid-mounted 3.6-liter Tipo F131 V8 features a flat-plane crankshaft, dry-sump lubrication, dual overhead camshafts, and five valves per cylinder. Factory-rated output was 395 horsepower and 275 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential.

The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.
